original_title: Sri Lanka confident of positive responses from creditors: Minister
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka is confident all creditors will look at the country positively, State Minister for Finance Shehan Semasinghe said.
Sri Lanka is awaiting official creditor responses from the Paris Club and India which is required for the International Monetary Fund to complete the first review of its program.
“We are confident that all creditors will look at Sri Lanka positively,” Semasinghe said.
China has already given a debt restructuring proposal for the bulk of its debt, which has come from its Exim Bank.
Sri Lanka is also talking to private creditors, though the IMF has not said it is critical for the review.

The staff report can be presented to the IMF’s executive board “all prior actions that have been agreed have been implemented carried out and “financing assurances reviews have been completed, which includes confirming whether adequate progress has been made with debt restructuring to give confidence [to the IMF’s Board]  that the restructuring will be concluded in a timely manner and in line with the program’s debt targets,” Senior Mission Chief Peter Breuer said last week.
